alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 12:57AM CST until January 28 at 11:16AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Chambers and Liberty Counties. Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Trinity River...including Moss Bluff...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Speaks, Strane Park...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Navidad River at Strane Park. * WHEN...Until late Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, Major lowland flooding begins with the river close to one third of a miles wide in the vicinity of the gage. County Road 401 is inundated and closed and the lowest homes in the flood plain are threatened. Livestock can be cut off in low lying parts of the flood plain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 AM CST Thursday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this afternoon to 28.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Saturday evening to 10.4 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will rise to 12.4 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 29.0 feet on 06/18/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Navidad River Strane Park 24.0 22.6 Thu 12 am CS 27.1 28.7 23.6 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM CST.
